dependencies.description:
Bowtie 2 is an ultrafast and memory-efficient tool for aligning
sequencing reads to long reference sequences
dependencies.name: bowtie2

dependencies.description:
FLASH (Fast Length Adjustment of SHort reads) is a very fast and
accurate software tool to merge paired-end reads from next-generation
sequencing experiments.
dependencies.name: flash

dependencies.description: Bayesian haplotype-based genetic polymorphism discovery and genotyping.
dependencies.name: freebayes

dependencies.description:
Genome Analysis Toolkit Variant Discovery in High-Throughput Sequencing
Data
dependencies.name: gatk

dependencies.description:
Heavily optimized library for DEFLATE/zlib/gzip compression and
decompression
dependencies.name: libdeflate

dependencies.description:
MAFFT is a multiple sequence alignment program for unix-like operating
systems. It offers a range of multiple alignment methods, L-INS-i
(accurate; for alignment of <~200 sequences), FFT-NS-2 (fast; for
alignment of <~30,000 sequences), etc.
dependencies.name: mafft

dependencies.description: Best-fit model selection
dependencies.name: modeltest-ng

dependencies.description: MUMmer is a system for rapidly aligning entire genomes.
dependencies.name: mummer

dependencies.description:
Picard is a set of command line tools for manipulating high-throughput
sequencing (HTS) data and formats such as SAM/BAM/CRAM and VCF.
dependencies.name: picard

dependencies.description:
A distributed collaborative effort to develop Python libraries and
applications which address the needs of current and future work in
bioinformatics.
dependencies.name: py-biopython

dependencies.description: Clean single-source support for Python 3 and 2
dependencies.name: py-future

dependencies.description: A command line tool for interacting with cloud storage services.
dependencies.name: py-gsutil

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description: PyYAML is a YAML parser and emitter for Python.
dependencies.name: py-pyyaml

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: A Client of HIVdb Sierra GraphQL Webservice
dependencies.name: py-sierrapy

dependencies.description: A built-package format for Python.
dependencies.name: py-wheel

dependencies.description: The Python programming language.
dependencies.name: python

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependencies.description:
RAxML-NG is a phylogenetic tree inference tool which uses maximum-
likelihood (ML) optimality criterion. Its search heuristic is based on
iteratively performing a series of Subtree Pruning and Regrafting (SPR)
moves, which allows to quickly navigate to the best-known ML tree.
RAxML-NG is a successor of RAxML (Stamatakis 2014) and leverages the
highly optimized likelihood computation implemented in libpll (Flouri et
al. 2014).
dependencies.name: raxml-ng

dependencies.description:
SAM Tools provide various utilities for manipulating alignments in the
SAM format, including sorting, merging, indexing and generating
alignments in a per-position format
dependencies.name: samtools

dependencies.description: Toolkit for processing sequences in FASTA/Q formats.
dependencies.name: seqtk

dependencies.description:
SPAdes - St. Petersburg genome assembler - is intended for both standard
isolates and single-cell MDA bacteria assemblies.
dependencies.name: spades

dependencies.description:
The NCBI SRA Toolkit enables reading ("dumping") of sequencing files
from the SRA database and writing ("loading") files into the .sra
format.
dependencies.name: sratoolkit

dependencies.description: A flexible read trimming tool for Illumina NGS data.
dependencies.name: trimmomatic

dependencies.description:
Trinity, developed at the Broad Institute and the Hebrew University of
Jerusalem, represents a novel method for the efficient and robust de
novo reconstruction of transcriptomes from RNA-seq data. Trinity
combines three independent software modules: Inchworm, Chrysalis, and
Butterfly, applied sequentially to process large volumes of RNA-seq
reads. Trinity partitions the sequence data into many individual de
Bruijn graphs, each representing the transcriptional complexity at a
given gene or locus, and then processes each graph independently to
extract full-length splicing isoforms and to tease apart transcripts
derived from paralogous genes.
dependencies.name: trinity

description:
HAplotype and PHylodynamics pipeline for viral assembly, population
genetics, and phylodynamics.
name: py-haphpipe

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
